intro: Rafinesquia comosa, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and large, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Rafinesquia comosa is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
